intro: Callisthene major, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a hairy texture. Callisthene major thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas.
